> <@pchimento:igalia.com> I'm not aware of any existing proposal for a `type: 'text'` import attribute, only `type: 'json'`

https://github.com/whatwg/html/issues/9444
content.formatted_body:
In reply to @pchimento:igalia.com
I'm not aware of any existing proposal for a type: 'text' import attribute, only type: 'json'
https://github.com/whatwg/html/issues/9444

content.body:
> <@pchimento:igalia.com> I'm not aware of any existing proposal for a `type: 'text'` import attribute, only `type: 'json'`

no accepted proposal, at least ðŸ˜‰ I feel the need to mention that "regularization of alternative import strategies" was part of the core of the Parser Augmentation proposal I advanced, and that includes providing a mechanism for e.g. WHATWG or W3C to define named import types for use in a specific environment without having to enshrine them in 262
content.formatted_body:
In reply to @pchimento:igalia.com
I'm not aware of any existing proposal for a type: 'text' import attribute, only type: 'json'
no accepted proposal, at least ðŸ˜‰ I feel the need to mention that "regularization of alternative import strategies" was part of the core of the Parser Augmentation proposal I advanced, and that includes providing a mechanism for e.g. WHATWG or W3C to define named import types for use in a specific environment without having to enshrine them in 262
